content.description: The center line of the big huecos
content.location: In the center of the gym

content.description: The left side of the big huecos.
content.location: In the center of the gym

content.description: Start on good huecos. Climb up through scoop and gain the lip to top out on jugs.
content.location: On main wall of Gymnasium, left of black water streak.

content.description: SDS Move right through slopey pockets and to a big throw up the black streak.
content.location: To the left of the black streak. Topout is shared with Only little people pay taxes

climbs.name: Only the Little people pay taxes

content.description: A short but fun problem. Start on edges and pockets right of the black water streak and move up and left to the "v" notch at the top of the water streak. Slap the slopey but good V and top out without the help of the tree behind you (you cheater ha).
content.protection: Crash pads and spotters. The tree roots are directly behind you, I can't remember if they're a problem or not.
content.location: In the center of the gymnasium directly in front of the tree but just to the right of the black water streak.

content.description: The right side of the big huecos.
content.location: In the center of the gym

content.description: Start on pockets at about head height and setup for the big move to a hueco at the top of small black streak. Pull the lip on somewhat friable holds.
content.location: In front of the big polished tree that has seen some down-climbing action over the years. A small black streak at the top of the problem helps identify it.

content.description: Jug bash up the obvious line of superb huecos and pockets to the left of the tree and water streak (that roughly marks the enter of the gymnasium). head rightish for the top out, which might be a little heady for a new climber but an excellent flat crash-site lies below you.
content.location: in the center of the gymnasium there is a tree that resides close to the wall. On the wall next to the tree is a very dark water streak. Bad Axe follows the obvious line of huecos about 10 feet left of the water streak.

content.description:
A long overhanging wall with many problems, mostly of moreate difficulty, V0-V3 and a harder problem or two. While many of the problems are easy they are also quite tall. The shortest ones are in the middle where there is a black water streak. The problems to the right of this are resonably tall while some of the problems to the left are down right huge. 

  A very difficult traverse from right to left exists as well with difficult sections at the water stain in the middle and at the very end. 

  The wall is more or less north facing and almost always in the shade and can be secluded as it is in a hidden slot.
